meanings.definition: A fringe or tassel worn by Jewish men as a reminder of the commandments.
meanings.sent1: The tzitzith on his garment swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: During the service, he made sure his tzitzith were visible.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly referred to his tzitzith as his 'reminder strings'.
meanings.sent4: The tzitzith served as a beacon of tradition in his family.
meanings.sent5: The colorful tzitzith added a touch of spirituality to his attire.

meanings.definition: The fringes of a prayer shawl.
meanings.sent1: She carefully knotted the tzitzith on the corners of the prayer shawl.
meanings.sent2: The tzitzith swayed gently as he prayed.
meanings.sent3: The tzitzith on the shawl danced like tiny ribbons in the wind.
meanings.sent4: His tzitzith were a symbol of his devotion during prayer.
meanings.sent5: The tzitzith fluttered like small flags of faith.
